Description: Jar of black-topped brown ware pottery made of fine Nile silt, with a globular body, round base and everted rim. Exterior is mottled brown with blackened rim, burnished horizontally around body. Interior is burnished at interior rim. A black fire cloud is on the base.
Curator's comments: Brunton’s (1937) Black-topped Brown BB82M. This jar is one of the rare examples of turned out rims within the corpus of Badarian pottery.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 49; pl. 14.2 left; pl. 15.82m)
